body:
No problem. We can forget about it. In any case I want to suggest other weird things in the future :))

For this I was inspirated by https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/actionpack/lib/action_view/helpers/tag_helper.rb#L146 (it allows to use array as class attribute: content_tag(:div, "...", :class => ['some', 'another']) and maybe https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/actionpack/lib/action_view/helpers/record_tag_helper.rb#L24 - div_for with collection as arg. I like build pieces html in my daily work similiar examples in the first comment.

Frankly speaking I confused a little bit about capture method (line 49)

``` ruby
buffer = with_output_buffer { value = yield(*args) }
# ...
```

I don't sure if is's ok for all templates engines, I checked Haml and Erb.
